text:
Good day everyone. I would like to explain a little bit our use case.
We have a Deal created in our system associated to two companies, one with association label, let's say Buyer, and the other one with association label "Seller". This deal is an opportunity created from our team.

Then a ticket is created in our system automatically if an activation is requested and this ticket is also associated with Company A (label = Buyer) and Company B (Seller) and what I am trying to do is check if the companies associated of this created ticket match with the same companies from our previous deal, matching the labels.

I tried to see if exists any query in API HubSpot to retrieve all the Deals from a specific pipeline and see for which label company record id is associated

Maybe any query that search a deal with the same companies associated that the ticket has

Hello everyone!!!
Quick question.
I’m using the Google AMP option for one of my blogs but SEMRUSH is showing 15 AMP HTML issues
I’ve been searching and there doesn’t seem to be an option to edit anything but what we have under the google AMP tab in the settings…
Is that correct? Are these templates and this content not able to be modified?

Hi all,

We're setting up a HubSpot API integration from our Website, for HubSpot users to post data into HubSpot.

As part of this we're looking to include the HubSpot Logo on our API set up page - I understand we need written permission to include this logo though - your Sales support team have pointed me in the direction of this Slack community for guidance on how I get this.

Any support / ideas / information is welcome. (Have put this in the random channel too)

Kind Regards,
Anton
New sales person was with us for 3 months before he realized that our CRM provider is not named `F*****g HubSpot`
Arlo you're my favorite person

Hey Arlo, while I understand there are some frustrations with HubSpot, lets try to keep things civil in this slack and reduce the name calling or disrespect of companies (whether that is HubSpot or even a competitor). This is a community centered around peer to peer relationships and helping users out.
I'm spending my day today working around the removal of an object from the quotes template that happened with no notice.
I'm teh CEO of a company and I'm coding around HubSpot's unrelenting, never reliable system.
I'll be civil when HubSpot stops acting like a 4 person startup running an MVP. Til then, kick me out if you must, but I'll take my 6 figure annual spend with me.
Of course, HubSpot could do like most companies and go hotfix the things you break, but we know that won't happen
Fast to break stuff, slow to own it, slower to fix.

I understand this frustration and I am happy to connect you with folks internally to have a further discussion about the issues you are running into if you would like me to. Would you be able to tell which object was removed and I can ask internally on this?
SUBTOTAL
isnt that a property?
you'd sure think so!
yeah I think I've seen that now that I think about it
it is an object in the JSON sense
but if you start your billing on ANY DATE other than "Immediate Payment" the subtotals object goes away.
oh yep now I understand

Why? :thinking_face: There’s nothing set about it in the template or advanced page settings, HubSpot is setting both of these styles. The second green and blue gradient is what is set for the section in the page editor, but it’s being overwritten by the orange and magenta one, which shows under `HubSpot Styles (default)`.
We have a 6 figure deal who wants to sign today, but the subtotals aren't showing up on the quotes now due to this change that happened iwth zero notice.
and guess what, they can't sign if the discount doesn't show on the quote
well lets fix that
what do you need help with
sure, it's in hubpot's underlying code in the quotes module.
Create a quote with line items with a future start date and the subtotal property just vanishes from the template data

Not something I can fix, so instead what I have to do now is simulate the subtotal property by looping throuh every line item and figuring out what the discount %s and flat discounts are so that I can then construct my own subtotal property to make up for HubSpot's lack of notice.
do you need help with that hubl or do you got it?
This is a production system. It's insane that things like this happen. My customers would fire me immediately if we did this.
I assume you're doing these calculations on the frontend. or are you doing them through a workflow?
We are doing them in the template.
yeah thought so
you know how to write the hubl right?
yes. I am an expert level HubSpot dev.
ok
but i'm not happy to be doing it.
thus the joke.
hey I totally get it man
I hear you
just wanted to make sure you got help

it's my day off. Instead of enjoying time with my family, I get to write code to make up for the fact that HubSpot keeps changing the underlying data.

4 months ago they just broke signatures in the last week of a quarter.
seemed to be pretty upset
It's a regular thing.
being upset?
Their dev team has zero QA
no, it's a regular thing that HubSpot quotes break.
as in they make changes and don't notify anybody, customers just have to find these things in production.
yeah that team could definitely do a better job of doing a changlog
glad you have a solution though, hit me up if you need help
even experts need help sometimes

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Seems like `dnd_area-row-0-background-layers` is maybe an old HubSpot class that got carried over somehow? Clicking the `Reset all styles` button got rid of it and fixed it.
Hello. My customers are getting the attached error message when downloading our app. Any clue how to resolve? HubSpot is telling me its my issue, but I cant find any issues.
Hi Anton, this should be a helpful guide for you <https://legal.HubSpot.com/tm-usage-guidelines|https://legal.HubSpot.com/tm-usage-guidelines>
do you want to copy the install link from the apps settings and then try?
I think you just have an outdated link
<https://app.HubSpot.com/ecosystem/7926105/marketplace/apps/marketing/lead-generation/slybroadcast-222095>  this is the link in the app marketplace.
How/why  would the link become outdated?
Thanks for your help!

Hey <@U01E3692GUF>, just wanted to give you an update. I had a conversation with the quotes team and they are rolling back that update that was made which is causing your issues. Please let me know if this has helped to resolve what you are facing.
that's how you do
Thanks AJ!
this is what a hero looks like: :aj:
Anytime Arlo! Always happy to help :slightly_smiling_face:
